trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> objects that are used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection> class to programmatically manage a set of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> objects.
Note that it is more typical to define these fields declaratively instead of programmatically.

You can access the properties and methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection> class through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
You can add, insert, and remove <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> objects by using the appropriate methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection> class.
To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> objects from a collection, do one of following:
Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object from the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an object that implements <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>, which you can then use to get items from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Count%2A> property gets the total number of items in the collection.
It is typically used to determine the upper bound of the collection.

You can add items and remove items in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.Insert%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> class.
This constructor is primarily used by control developers.
The control that will contain the collection.
Appends the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object is added to the end of the collection.
The object to append to the collection.
Creates a copy of the current collection.
This method is primarily used in design-time dialog boxes to implement rollback behavior when an operation is canceled.
The object that contains the collection.
An object that contains a copy of each <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object that is in the current collection.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object.
The object to locate in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection contains the specified field; otherwise, `false`.

Copies the complete <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection to a one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> object, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
The array object must use zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying starts.
Creates a default instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> type that is identified by the provided index.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.CreateKnownType%2A> method is called internally by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection> collection in its implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.CreateKnownType%2A> method creates an instance of an object by using the type identified by the specified `index`, which maps to one of the types returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.GetKnownTypes%2A> method.

The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> type to create from the ordered list of types that are returned by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.GetKnownTypes"></xref> method.
An object that represents an instance of a class that is derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> class, according to the index provided.
The specified index is not in the recognized range.
Occurs when the fields in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection change.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.FieldsChanged> event is usually raised as a result of a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.Insert%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.Remove%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Gets an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> types that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection can contain.
An array of type objects that identify the types of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> objects that the collection can contain.
Gets the index of a specific <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object in the collection.
The object to locate in the collection.
The index of the field parameter, if it is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.

Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index at which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object will be inserted.
The object to insert.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object that is at the specified index in the collection.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object that is at the specified index in the collection.
Performs additional processing after all items are removed from the collection.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A> method to perform additional processing after all items are removed from the collection.
This method raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.FieldsChanged> event.
Performs additional processing after an item is added to the collection.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.Insert%2A> method to perform additional processing after an item is added to the collection.
This method raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.FieldsChanged> event.
The index in the collection that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object was inserted at.
The object that was inserted into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
Performs additional processing after an item is removed from the collection.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to perform additional processing after an item is removed from the collection.
This method raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.FieldsChanged> event.
The index in the collection that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object was removed from.
The object that was removed from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
Verifies that the specified object is a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object.
This method is called internally to validate an element of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection> collection.
The method performs type-checking and verifies that the object specified in the `o` parameter is not `null`.
The object to validate.
o is `null`.
o is not an instance of the class or of one of its derived classes.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
The object to remove from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object at the specified index from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection"></xref> collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object to remove.
Instructs the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object to record its complete state to view state, instead of recording only changed information.
This method is primarily used by control developers.
The object to mark as changed since the last time that view state was loaded or saved.
